notes: Eighteen are dead as the people of Vwang district in Jos riot
A muslim militia kill a police officer with an arrow in Kano.
Nigerias Justice Minister Bola Ige has been shot dead by unknown assailants in Ibadan.
An armed group kill five travelers.
11 are dead when members of the village of Okodia attack the village of Biseni to avenge the death of a fishermen.
Rioters in Hadejia burn down the local police station when the department released a known criminal.
Four are dead when the government funded ""Bakassi Boys attack market traders in Owerri."
Police kill two armed robbers in the Federal Capital Territory.
Odunayo Olagbaju
A dunked soldier open fire on a group of Muslims
An Islamic militia on the heels of fighting in Jos burn two churches in Kano."
Five police officers are killed by robbers on a highway.
A former Christian minister narrowly escaped an attack from Islamic fundamentalists who accused him of misrepresenting a high profile Muslim figure.
A Muslim group kills one and burns 11 churches in protest of a Islamic preacher being arrested.
A British oil worker
The Tiv ethnic militia attacks a Sunti ethnic settlement in Taraba State and kills at least 50 in the process.

No fewer than five persons were feared dead while 25 others were seriously injured during a bloody clash between rival Ilaje communities in Ondo State over the sharing of 150m naira oil money meant for the oil producing communities in the area.
Two are thought dead when a protest against the National Electric Power Authority (NEPA) turns violent.
A second strike launched in Maiduguri with protests over the shooting of four striking wokrers by police earlier in the week
A group of armed robbers kill three in the town of Yaba in a described show of power to the inhabitants.

Four people were feared dead as anti-riot armed mobile policemen engaged protesters in a battle; as the long-drawn industrial dispute between the state government and the striking civil servants took a turn for the worst. The Nigeria Labour Congress later in protested the shooting of four workers by men of the Borno State Police Command in Maiduguri.

The state Commissioner of Police alleged at a news conference that striking workers had attacked doctors and members of voluntary organisations such as the Red Cross, who were rendering skeletal services at the Maiduguri Specialist Hospital since the commencement of the strike. He cited an attack on the general manager of Borno Radio Television (BRTV), who was attacked at his residence by some workers following the resumption of broadcasts by the station.
The home of the President of Nigeria was raided by six armed robbers. No reported deaths.
Four police are killed when they are attacked by armed robbers.
A group of civilians resist robbers
At least 13 are dead as the townspeople of Makurdi riot over the recent increased military presence around the area due to religious battles.
The military in Makurdi gun down 200 civilians in matter of two days in order to enforce curfew in the riot-torn city.

Muslims in Borno and Yobe states are holding special prayers called qunut in support of the people of Afghanistan and for the retreat of the Anglo-American forces following US military strikes against the Central Asian country. Accompanying demonstrations were held in Yobe and Borno states.

Following a spate of attacks on Chadian residents in Banki, a border town in Borno State, President Idris Deby of Chad has petitioned his Nigerian counterpart, Chief Olusegun Obasanjo. The last attack which took place about a fortnight ago reportedly left seven people dead.
COUNCILLORS in Borno State have protested against the recent decision by the Federal Government to reduce their remuneration from N125,000 to N53,833.75, describing it as "unfair and unjustifiable."

Muslims in Borno and Yobe states are holding special prayers called qunut in support of the people of Afghanistan and for the retreat of the Anglo-American forces following US military strikes against the Central Asian country. Accompanying demonstrations were held in Yobe and Borno states.
200 are dead along with property destroyed when Muslim and Christian militias battle in the streets of Kano over differing viewpoints of the newly begun U.S. airstrikes in Afghanistan.
Okrika Island youths kill four Rivers State police for unknown reasons.
A group of 14 robbers invade a Lagos bank and escape with cash before one of the group is shot and killed.
Five police are shot dead by armed men at the Nigeria-Benin border. Their aim
An unknown group of youths attacked a Shell oil facility and injured a worker in the process. As a result the facility has been closed and production at the facility has been lost.
Two groups in the Okrika community have split into factions and involves themselves in battle
Three are killed with infighting among the Ijaw ethnic militia.
Six students are dead following an attack by a cult group from in Kwara State.
AN armed group attacked 5 foreign pilots who had recently arrived in Nigeria.

Six days of religious riots between Christians and Muslims (likely Berom - Fulani/Hausa) begins in Jos after offence was taken by Muslims when a Christian woman refused to walk around a Mosque during Friday evening prayers. Approximately 1000 deaths reported over the course of six days.
One student is killed and 13 others injured as two rival cult groups clash in Ikot Ekpene.

Six days of religious riots between Christians and Muslims (likely Berom - Fulani/Hausa) begins in Jos after offence was taken by Muslims when a Christian woman refused to walk around a Mosque during Friday evening prayers. Approximately 1000 deaths reported over the course of six days.

Six days of religious riots between Christians and Muslims (likely Berom - Fulani/Hausa) begins in Jos after offence was taken by Muslims when a Christian woman refused to walk around a Mosque during Friday evening prayers. Approximately 1000 deaths reported over the course of six days.
22 inmates of a Jos prison are dead over the course of a month when Muslims and Christian clashed inside the prison.

Six days of religious riots between Christians and Muslims (likely Berom - Fulani/Hausa) begins in Jos after offence was taken by Muslims when a Christian woman refused to walk around a Mosque during Friday evening prayers. Approximately 1000 deaths reported over the course of six days.

Six days of religious riots between Christians and Muslims (likely Berom - Fulani/Hausa) begins in Jos after offence was taken by Muslims when a Christian woman refused to walk around a Mosque during Friday evening prayers. Approximately 1000 deaths reported over the course of six days.
The militia known as the Bakassi Boys attack and kill a person believed to a regional mafia boss.

Six days of religious riots between Christians and Muslims (likely Berom - Fulani/Hausa) begins in Jos after offence was taken by Muslims when a Christian woman refused to walk around a Mosque during Friday evening prayers. Approximately 1000 deaths reported over the course of six days.
The police shoot and kill four students at the University of Lagos in an attempt to break up a clash.
A member of the House of Representatives
Twenty are killed as ethnic unrest breaks out in Degema
Attack on civilians in Owo. Perpetrators not known.
Cultists kidnap a civilian and in a ritualistic fashion kill them.
At least four are dead when Muslims and Christian clash over the implementation of a strict Islamic law.
Police shoot and kill and wound three when civilians protest the presence of the president of the Nigerian Senate.
An Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) attached to Shell Development Company in Lagos has been shot dead by unidentified gunmen.
Armed men kill a four year old girl who were looking for her father. Following the murder they took N80
A commercial bus driver was kidnapped in Lagos by gunmen.
A legislator representing Rivers State is shot dead by armed assailants. A political motive is not known.
The ethnic militias of the Tiv and Jukun peoples clash in Benue State for unknown reasons.
Sixteen soldiers are dead as they attempt to bring an end to the violence between the Tiv and Jukun peoples in Benue State.

At least fifty are killed when Islamic and Christian militias battle in Jos. Trying to restore order the government of the area have implemented curfews. Unsubstantiated reports have the death toll as high as 165.
Two robbers are shot dead after police caught up with them algon Ikorodu road while robbing a bus.
Armed men kill a police officer and wound another in Ogun State before stealing their Jeep.
A gang kills 22 in a revenge attack on a civilian anti-crime group.
Gunmen kill two police and snatch N3 million from a Lagos socialite.
Communal/ethnic clashes took place in Itu.
A rebel group attacks the town of Ilorin killing one student.
Fifty are killed and 40 houses are destroyed when ethnic militias clash in various unknown locations in Plateau State.
A customs officer escaped death following an attack form an armed gang who invaded his house.
200 are killed in fighting between Tiv and Lafia militias.
A police officer attacks a baby and is mother for unknown reason
A gang of youths steal a truck belonging to the Shell Petroleum Development Corporation (SPDC) and one member is shot and killed by police.
Two staffers of Ushongo Local Government of Benue State may have been killed in a renewed communal clash between the Ukan people of Ushongo and Ipaav in Gboko Local Government Area.

Police used teargas and a baton charge to break up a demonstration that marred the introduction of Islamic law. The demonstration had been staged by Muslim traditional beggars (Almajiris) angry that the state governor and emir had failed to hold a ceremony for the occasion. Police reported using tear gas to break up the demonstration after some protesters set fire to part of the square in which they were demonstrating. Elsewhere in the city, angry crowds torched several office buildings, including a local chamber of commerce.
A church and mosque were set ablaze in Kumo Town when it was decided Gombe State would adopt the sharia
Thieves killed a police officer and stole a jeep who was working security for the US embassy.
Two "ECOMOG" (party militia) factions of the APP engaged in physical violence while the Vice President was commissioning the Konduga Township Stadium
Soldiers raid a Benus State town and kill three in apparent retaliation for a previous attack by an ethnic militia.
Eleven are killed by Islamic Militia as they attempt to enforce Islamic sharia law upon the city.
21 are dead in a week-long fight between the Tiv and Fulani ethnic peoples in Benue State. This is a new spark in a lingering feud.
Twenty are dead when Fulani and Jukun ethnic militias attack the Tiv ethnic militia.
Twenty are dead after a clash between ethnic communities in Taraba State.
Nine are killed when ethnic communities in Delta State clash over the ownership of an oil field.
Three PDP militants are dead after a failed attempt on the Delta State governor.
Agege militants engage Odimodi militants because they allegedly invaded their village.
14 are dead as Kundum and Nyeswe communities clash.
14 are killed when two ethnic militias engage in fighting over control of the economy.
Ten are killed in a political clash between the PDP and APP of election results in Igbokoda.
Unknown men attacked two Cuban nationals
Islamic militants attack a total of eight hotels in Kano city due to the fact they stocked alcoholic drinks.
Gunmen attack the sister of the Inspector-General of Police
Ten are killed when Muslim and Christian militias battle in northern Kaduna State.
Approximately 20 people, including a Police Inspector, were killed during a bloody clash between a group of Niger nationals, allied with Chadians, suspected to be rebels and police in Maiduguri.
At least two people have been killed and eight seriously injured in clashes between rival political groups in the northwestern Nigerian state of Zamfara
One killed and several injured in an cult group clash between the groups known as Black Axe and the Vikings.
Two are reported killed when two ethnic militias clash at an unknown location in Ogoni State.
Nine people were killed and 15 others injured when a group of ethnic Fulani nomads clashed with villagers in northeast Nigeria early Monday, in the village of Ajigin, in a remote part of Borno state.
Students riot in Enugu when it is learned that their fees are going to increase.
An unknown group attacked and kidnapped the PDP leader of Enugu State Chief Chijoke Edoga outside a hotel in the capital city."
A Lagos City militia captured
Police kill two members of the OPC as they stormed their headquarters for unknown reasons.
Five are killed and ten wounded as police attempt to stop a clash of Shiite Muslims protesting the Israeli ambassadors visit to Gombe.
Armed men kill a police officer in Ogba
At least 20 are dead following renewed violence between the Ke
Armed men attack the controller of immigration at his home on Victoria Island
A man was beaten to death by a mob for an alleged raping of a small girl.
Recently teachers in Borno State protested non-payment of their salaries, but did not participate in an on-going nationwide strike at that time.
Two Fulani herdsmen reported killed in an attack in Ajigin area.

Hundreds of Muslim youths went on the rampage burning churches and beer parlours late Tuesday in Maiduguri, after sighting the eclipse which appeared across Africa. Many non-Muslims fled to a nearby military barracks for safety. Riot policemen used teargas to disperse them.

Three people were killed and three villages were burned down in northeastern Nigeria in fresh fighting between farmers and herdsmen. Farmers clashed again Tuesday with nomads near Damboa town in Borno state, barely a week after a similar clash claimed five lives, left seven people wounded and three villages razed.
Gunmen broke into the home of a Lagso based Israeli businessman and killed him.

A total of five people were killed, seven wounded and three villages burned down in northeastern Nigeria after a herd of cattle wandered onto the wrong patch of grass. A farmer in northern Borno State tracked down and killed a nomadic cattle herder who had allowed his cows onto the farmers land, damaging and eating his crops. Clashes erupted and five people were killed in the violence.
